description.p: You can make a Hermeticist quickly by following these suggestions. First, make your spellcasting ability your highest ability score. Second, choose the sage background.
As a hermeticist, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 6 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d6 (or 4) + your Constitution modifier per hermeticist level after 1st
Skills: Choose two from Acrobatics, Arcana, Athletics, History, Insight, Investigation, and Perception.

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a component pouch or (b) an arcane focus
(a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a scholar’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack

sheet.description: A magic user who can freely cast magic that don't challenge the established limits of Hermetic Theory.

setters.set: A scholarly magic-user capable of manipulating the structures of reality.

multiclass.prerequisite: Constitution 13 and Intelligence 13, Wisdom 13, or Charisma 13

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you have attained the ability to manipulate the raw energies of the world, so long as you operate under a set of rules. To create spells you can combine different Techniques and Forms to achieve different effects. Careful preparation is required for all but the most advanced Hermetic Mages.

Spellcraft is your power to manipulate and control different aspects of Hermetic Magic. In order to cast a spell you must expend Spellcraft equal to the cost of the spell. Your Spellcraft equals your Spell Level, and you regain all spent Spellcraft at the start of each of your turns.

Starting at 1st level, you can attune yourself to the weave, channeling its energies into yourself allowing access to magic. As an action you can open yourself up to the weave, filling yourself with its power. While channeling, other Hermeticists will be able to tell if you are holding the weave by an aura that surrounds you. Channeling too much through the weave has the potential to burn yourself out if you’re not careful, however, and caution is advised to ensure you don’t lose yourself to its addictive power. You gain one level of fatigue for every hour you channel. If you have levels of fatigue already, your current fatigue doubles for every hour instead.

If you attempt to cast a spell that is beyond your safe limit for channeling, you gain one level of fatigue for every level past your Spellcraft limit. The more fatigue you have, the longer you will need to take a break to recover before channeling again. 1 minute at 1 (Winded), 10 minutes at 2 (Weary), 30 minutes at 3 (Tired), and 1 hour at 4 (Dazed). At 5+ levels, you cannot channel again until you finish a long rest. You cannot channel during the recovery period. At 6+ levels of fatigue you are forced to drop channeling. If you somehow accumulate 10 levels of fatigue, you burn out. You lose access to channeling and can only regain the ability to do so with a wish spell.

The Hermeticism table shows your Spell Level, which increases as you level, allowing you to cast more powerful spells of which you are trained in. You can only cast one spell with a magnitude component, and gain the ability to do so again at the start of each of your turns.
Your spellcasting ability is determined by your hermetic study. See the Study feature of your hermetic study for your spellcasting ability.

Some spell effects do not remain permanent upon being cast. Using Creo to heal a wound will only suppress the effects until the duration ends, never truly healing it. In order to bypass this limit, a ritual cast must take place, consuming raw magical energy, vis, in the process. Ritual casts take 10 minutes, and can cast spells with a duration of Until Dispelled or Triggered, or Permanent.
Hermetic magic is imperfect, and there are some things outside of its realm of influence. Spells you cast cannot defy these limitations.
Limit of Aging. Cannot halt or reverse aging.
Limit of Arcane Connections. Cannot affect an un-sensed target without an arcane connection.
Limit of Concentration. While concentrating on a spell with a magnitude, you cannot cast another magnitude spell. You expend 1 Spellcraft at the start of each of your turns to maintain Concentration.
Limit of Creation. Cannot create anything permanently without expending vis. Can only maintain one magical beast at a time, and spells to create or control beasts require concentration.
Limit of Depth. A creature can only be affected by one buff and debuff, and duration magnitude spell inflicted by Hermeticism at any given time.
Limit of Energy. Cannot restore one’s own physical energy.

Limit of Healing. Without access to ritual magic, Creo spells that attempt to heal a wound instead grant temporary hit points that last until the duration ends. Granting temporary hit points in this way does not scale with spell level increases to magnitude.
Limit of the Infernal. Detection magic is useless against demons(reveals only what that demon wants you to believe).
Limit of Longevity. Duration spells with magnitude do not scale with spell level increases to magnitude.
Limit of Resistance. A creature under the effects of a debuff or duration magnitude spell can repeat their saving throw to dispel the effect at the start of each of their turns.
Limit of the Soul. Cannot create an immortal soul.
Limit of Time. Cannot alter passage of time. Cannot affect past or directly affect future.
Limit of True Feeling. Some strong instances of love/friendship/faith cannot be altered.

Vis is the raw magical energy of any given Hermetic form, and can be used to strengthen spell casting. To produce vis, the caster must perform an 8 hour ritual pouring magical energy into a medium of one of the forms. If you are proficient in the form you are creating you create a number of vis equal to your proficiency bonus, otherwise you only create 1. If you cast a spell of a form of which you have Vis prepared, you can increase its spell level by 1 per each Vis consumed in the casting, to a maximum of your proficiency bonus.
You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your hermeticist spells.

sheet.description: You cast spells gooder.

description.p: Change | Create | Destroy | Detect

sheet.description: Change | Create | Destroy | Detect

description.p: Choose a Hermetic Study, which describes how your gift manifests. Your choice grants you features when you choose it at 1st level and again at 3rd, 6th, 10th, 14th, and 20th level.
You gain proficiency in one Hermetic Techniques and Form. Spells cast using your major can consist of one non proficient Technique or Form at spell level 1.
Trained techniques and forms create more efficient spells that utilize them.
Proficiency with a technique and form allows you to use your full spellcraft limit.

Additionally, you can modify existing spells with additional techniques and forms you are trained in to cast a complex spell. Complex spells only retain their proficiency bonuses if all techniques and forms are trained.
You gain proficiency in one Hermetic Techniques and Form.

Starting at 2nd level, you gain the ability to create small fragments of Vis, which can temporarily store magic inside them. When you cast a spell, you can condense the spell’s energy into a fragment of vis embodying the form used to create it.

A creature holding this fragment can use its action to release the spell within, whereupon the fragment disappears. The spell uses your attack bonus and save DC, and the spell treats the creature who released it as the caster for all other purposes.

Once you create a bead with this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Attempting to create a second bead will destroy the first, vanishing in a flash of light, losing the spell.

The spell uses your attack bonus and save DC, and the spell treats the creature who released it as the caster for all other purposes. description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
You gain proficiency in light armor, medium armor, shields, simple weapons, and martial weapons.

sheet.description: Your Spellcasting Ability Modifier is Charisma (+{{hermeticist spellcasting modifier}}).

description.p: You have chosen to embrace Vim, the unique crystalline energy of demons, enhancing your magical core with excess magical energy which threatens your stability. While channeling, your weapons can use your charisma modifier in place of its strength or dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.
You are considered a half caster for the purposes of spell level advancement and proficiencies, and use Charisma as your spell casting modifier.

sheet.description: While channeling, your weapons can use your charisma modifier in place of its strength or dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

description.p: Alongside your magic studies, you have been trained in combat. You learn 1 stance and 1 fighting style. The number of stances learned from this feature increases at 5th level, 9th level, and 13th level.
If you meet its requirements, you can enter into a stance as a bonus action, allowing for more unique ways to express your fighting styles.
You ready yourself into a state of alertness. You can make opportunity attacks against enemies that enter into your reach.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon | You ready yourself into a state of alertness. You can make opportunity attacks against enemies that enter into your reach.

description.p: You focus your defenses on engaging multiple opponents, thriving when outnumbered. When there is more than 1 enemy within your reach, you can take the dodge action as a bonus action.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon | You focus your defenses on engaging multiple opponents, thriving when outnumbered. When there is more than 1 enemy within your reach, you can take the dodge action as a bonus action.

description.p: You concentrate your blow into a final piercing strike. You can choose to attack with disadvantage; if it hits, the attack does max damage.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon with Reach property | You concentrate your blow into a final piercing strike. You can choose to attack with disadvantage; if it hits, the attack does max damage.

element.name: The Boar Rushes Down the Mountain

description.p: You cleave the enemy with all of your might, leaving yourself vulnerable. Doing so gives you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon with Heavy property | You cleave the enemy with all of your might, leaving yourself vulnerable. Doing so gives you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

description.p: You blitz your enemy, striking them before they can react. Your movement speed increases by 10ft. You can take the disengage action as a bonus action.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon with Light property | You blitz your enemy, striking them before they can react. Your movement speed increases by 10ft. You can take the disengage action as a bonus action.

description.p: You parry an incoming blow, deflecting it and opening up your enemy. As a reaction when an enemy misses a melee attack against you, you can roll a contested attack roll. On a success, you cause the enemy to drop their weapon.

sheet.description: Shield | You parry an incoming blow, deflecting it and opening up your enemy. As a reaction when an enemy misses a melee attack against you, you can roll a contested attack roll. On a success, you cause the enemy to drop their weapon.

description.p: You pick off a distracted enemy from afar. When you make a ranged weapon attack against an enemy that is within 5ft of an ally, you can reroll your damage roll and use either result.

sheet.description: Ranged Weapon | You pick off a distracted enemy from afar. When you make a ranged weapon attack against an enemy that is within 5ft of an ally, you can reroll your damage roll and use either result.

description.p: Starting at level 3, you learn how to channel your magic through your weaponry, imbuing it with the power of Vim. As an action, you can make a spellstrike with a weapon you are wielding. Make a weapon attack, on hit, the weapon deals extra damage equal to your spell level number of the weapon’s damage die. This counts as casting a magnitude spell for the purposes of Hermetic magic calculations.

sheet.description: You can make a spellstrike with a weapon you are wielding. Make a weapon attack, on hit, the weapon deals extra damage equal to {{spell level:usage}} of the weapon’s damage die. This counts as casting a magnitude spell for the purposes of Hermetic magic calculations.

description.p: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. Additionally, one of these attacks can be a spellstrike.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. Additionally, one of these attacks can be a spellstrike.

description.p: Starting at level 6, you can surrender part of your core to the corruption to enter a hyper state, drawing out more power from your curse but putting your life at risk. While in this state, you generate stacks of corruption at the start of your turn. Corruption manifests itself as crystalline cysts on your skin. You can have a number of stacks of corruption equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). When you reach max stacks of corruption, your next turn you will take damage equal to a number of d6 equal to your corruption stacks. You can use stacks of corruption to increase your spell level for successful spell strikes and Hermetic Spells. You receive one level of fatigue upon exiting this form.

sheet.description: Starting at level 6, you can surrender part of your core to the corruption to enter a hyper state, drawing out more power from your curse but putting your life at risk. While in this state, you generate stacks of corruption at the start of your turn. Corruption manifests itself as crystalline cysts on your skin. You can have a number of stacks of corruption equal to {{charisma:modifier}}. When you reach max stacks of corruption, your next turn you will take damage equal to a number of d6 equal to your corruption stacks. You can use stacks of corruption to increase your spell level for successful spell strikes and Hermetic Spells.

description.p: Starting at level 10, When an enemy dies after receiving a corruption-charged attack from you in the last turn, you siphon a fragment of vis from their essence, restoring 1 level of fatigue and restoring health equal to your proficiency bonus + Charisma Modifier(minimum of 1).

sheet.description: When an enemy dies after receiving a corruption-charged attack from you in the last turn, you siphon a fragment of vis from their essence, restoring 1 level of fatigue and restoring health equal to your {{proficiency}} + {{charisma:modifier}}.

description.p: Starting at level 14, frequent exposure to your curse has enabled you to enter a temporary state of full demonization. You can fully demonize for 1 minute. While in this state, you are immune to non magical piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage. Your corruption increases by 2 at the start of every turn, and is no longer capped. Corruption stacks do not burst until the end of this ability. After killing an enemy, drain heals an additional amount of health equal to your current stacks of corruption. If your max health falls below half its maximum, make a DC 10 wisdom save. On a failure you immediately attack whoever is nearest to you. You receive two levels of fatigue upon exiting this form.

sheet.description: You fully demonize for 1 minute. While in this state, you are immune to non magical piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage. Your corruption increases by 2 at the start of every turn, and is no longer capped. Corruption stacks do not burst until the end of this ability. On a failure you immediately attack whoever is nearest to you.

description.p: Starting at level 20, you have descended to a demonic state. You gain immunity to fire damage, and are considered a Fiend. You learn the Demonic Stance.

sheet.description: You are considered a Fiend.

description.p: You enter a constant state of demonization near death. While under half health, you fully demonize. You do not take damage from corruption bursts while under half health. When you take damage, you can expend any number of stacks of corruption. Reduce the damage by 1d6 per stack. If you reduce the damage to 0, the stacks burst, sending crystal fragments flying into the enemy and damaging them for the damage that was reduced.

sheet.description: Free Hand | You enter a constant state of demonization near death. While under half health, you fully demonize. You do not take damage from corruption bursts while under half health. When you take damage, you can expend any number of stacks of corruption. Reduce the damage by 1d6 per stack. If you reduce the damage to 0, the stacks burst, sending crystal fragments flying into the enemy and damaging them for the damage that was reduced.
Your Spellcasting Ability Modifier is Intelligence.

description.p: You have been exposed to ancient technology, and from it you gained the ability to understand the structure of any non living construct. With a profound understanding of the laws of creation, and the ability to analyze the composition of matter, you are second to none when it comes to understanding advanced mechanizations and designs. While channeling, you can finely tune your Area of Effect spells, rendering those you wish immune to its effects.
You are considered a full caster for the purposes of spell level advancement and proficiencies.

sheet.description: While channeling, you can finely tune your Area of Effect spells, rendering those you wish immune to its effects.

description.p: Starting at first level, you gain a 30 ft realm of influence. Within this range, you are acutely aware of the presence of the Hermetic forms you are proficient in. While channeling, spells cast targeting these forms have a range of touch and do not require sight.
Additionally, whenever you cast a spell with an AoE component, you can choose to use your Domain as the Area of Effect instead.

sheet.description: You gain a {{domain:range}} ft realm of influence. Within this range, you are acutely aware of the presence of the Hermetic forms you are proficient in. While channeling, spells cast targeting these forms have a range of touch and do not require sight. Additionally, whenever you cast a spell with an AoE component, you can choose to use your Domain as the Area of Effect instead.

description.p: At 3rd level, changes to your Domain last until you stop channeling or the affected area exits your Domain’s range. Spells that target forms you are proficient in do not require duration components within your Domain.

sheet.description: Changes to your Domain last until you stop channeling or the affected area exits your Domain’s range. Spells that target forms you are proficient in do not require duration components within your Domain.

description.p: At 6th level, as an action while channeling, or as part of the action used to begin channeling you can surround yourself in a thin magical barrier for 1 minute. This shell costs 2 fatigue to manifest, and varying effects depending on the forms you are proficient in.

sheet.description: At 6th level, as an action while channeling, or as part of the action used to begin channeling you can surround yourself in a thin magical barrier for 1 minute.

description.p: You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed as you manipulate storm winds surrounding you.

sheet.description: You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed as you manipulate storm winds surrounding you.

description.p: Damage you take is reduced by your proficiency bonus as chunks of stone gyrate around you, absorbing impacts.

sheet.description: Damage you take is reduced by {{proficiency}} as chunks of stone gyrate around you, absorbing impacts.

description.p: A creature that touches or hits you with a melee attack takes fire damage equal to your level as a fiery cloak incinerates them.

sheet.description: A creature that touches or hits you with a melee attack takes {{level}} fire damage as a fiery cloak incinerates them.

description.p: A creature that touches or hits you with a melee attack must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC to avoid being poisoned for 1 minute as swarms of insects attack them.

sheet.description: A creature that touches or hits you with a melee attack must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC to avoid being poisoned for 1 minute as swarms of insects attack them.

description.p: You gain an illusory projection of yourself which mimics your actions. Attacks against you have disadvantage.

sheet.description: You gain an illusory projection of yourself which mimics your actions. Attacks against you have disadvantage.

description.p: Spells you cast are enhanced by the gyrating sphere of water surrounding you, dealing an extra 1d8 cold damage and freezing the target, reducing its movement speed by 15ft.

sheet.description: Spells you cast are enhanced by the gyrating sphere of water surrounding you, dealing an extra 1d8 cold damage and freezing the target, reducing its movement speed by 15ft.

description.p: At 10th level, you are always proficient in spells utilizing your major form within your Domain, and can cast them at full strength even if you do not know the corresponding technique.
Additionally, your Domain’s range increases to 60ft.

sheet.description: You are always proficient in spells utilizing your major form within your Domain, and can cast them at full strength even if you do not know the corresponding technique.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, creatures inside your Domain cannot exit its range while you are channeling unless you allow them to.
Additionally, your Domain reacts to threats instinctively. While channeling your Domain always provides you at least the benefits of half cover.

sheet.description: Creatures inside your Domain cannot exit its range while you are channeling unless you allow them to. Additionally, your Domain reacts to threats instinctively. While channeling your Domain always provides you at least the benefits of half cover.

description.p: Starting at level 20, your Domain’s range can be however large or small as you wish. Meticulous Control applies to your minor form within your Domain.

sheet.description: Your Domain’s range can be however large or small as you wish. Meticulous Control applies to your minor form within your Domain.
Your Spellcasting Ability Modifier is Charisma.

description.p: While channeling, you can use your charisma modifier for Wisdom (Medicine) checks, and whenever you use a spell to grant temporary hit points to a creature, the creature gains additional temporary hit points equal to your charisma modifier.
You are considered a full caster for the purposes of spell level advancement and proficiencies.

sheet.description: While channeling, you can use your charisma modifier for Wisdom (Medicine) checks, and whenever you use a spell to grant temporary hit points to a creature, the creature gains additional temporary hit points equal to your charisma modifier.

description.p: Starting at first level, your unique nature allows you to sustain your allies. As a bonus action for one fatigue, you can target a number of creatures up to your proficiency bonus you can see. These creatures gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your charisma modifier (minumum of 1), and at the start of your next turn have any temporary hit points converted into healing.

sheet.description: You can target up to {{proficiency}} creatures you can see. These creatures gain {{purity:limit}} temporary hit points, and at the start of your next turn have any temporary hit points converted into healing.

description.p: Starting at third level, you exude an aura of divinity which blesses your allies. At the start of each of your turns you can grant a creature within 10ft of you a minor blessing for one round. Whenever they make an attack roll or a saving throw before the effect ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

sheet.description: At the start of each of your turns you can grant a creature within 10ft of you a minor blessing for one round. Whenever they make an attack roll or a saving throw before the effect ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

description.p: Starting at level 6, as an action while, or as part of the action used to begin channeling you can partially manifest your heavenly gift for 1 minute. While in this state, you generate one mote of purity at the start of each of your turns, up to your charisma modifier (Minimum of 1). Generated motes can be distributed to creatures within 30 ft of you on your turn without action on your part, and restore one health per mote at the start of each of your turns.
Additionally, while in this state Mend does not inflict fatigue. You suffer two levels of fatigue upon exiting this state.

sheet.description: While, or as part of the action used to begin channeling, you can partially manifest your heavenly gift for 1 minute. While in this state, you generate one mote of purity at the start of each of your turns, up to {{purity:limit}}. Generated motes can be distributed to creatures within 30 ft of you on your turn without action on your part, and restore one health per mote at the start of each of your turns. Additionally, while in this state Mend does not inflict fatigue.

description.p: Starting at level 10, you can spend Vis to undo debilitating effects. You can reduce the target’s exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:
Stacks of Fatigue
One effect that charmed, blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, or petrified the target.
One curse, including the target’s attunement to a cursed magic item.
Any reduction to one of the target’s ability scores.
One effect reducing the target’s hit point maximum.

sheet.description: You can spend Vis to undo debilitating effects. You can reduce the target’s exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target: Stacks of Fatigue One effect that charmed, blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, or petrified the target. One curse, including the target’s attunement to a cursed magic item. Any reduction to one of the target’s ability scores. One effect reducing the target’s hit point maximum.

description.p: Starting at level 14, frequent exposure to your angelic nature has enabled you to enter a temporary state of full angelification for 1 minute as an action while channeling, or as part of the action used to begin channeling. In a full angelification state, you are immune to non magical piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage. Your purity increases by 2 at the start of every turn, and is no longer capped.
Additionally, while in this state Mend does not inflict fatigue, and the amount of temporary hit points is increased by your spell level. You suffer three levels of fatigue upon exiting this state.

sheet.description: While, or as part of the action used to begin channeling, you can fully angelificate for 1 minute. While in this state, you are immune to non magical piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage. Your purity increases by 2 at the start of every turn, and is no longer capped. Additionally, while in this state Mend does not inflict fatigue, and the amount of temporary hit points is increased by your spell level {{spell level:usage}}.

description.p: Starting at level 20, you are no longer bound by lesser limits, and have ascended to the divine state.
You have successfully halted the process of aging.
You gain immunity to radiant damage, and are considered a celestial.
You can use purity instead of Vis for your Restoration feature.

sheet.description: You have successfully halted the process of aging. You are considered a celestial. You can use purity instead of Vis for your Restoration feature.
Your Spellcasting Ability Modifier is Blight +{{hermeticist:spellcasting:modifier}}.

description.p: You were gifted with the damning power of blight, a strong maddening magic source represented by tar and blackness. This gift is slowly driving you mad, but infuses you with an unreal power. Do not be consumed by this power, as overuse will surely spell your doom. Your spell level increases by 1. While channeling, other Hermeticists can detect a sickly aura around you. Most people are hostile to or afraid of those they know with Blight.

Once you connect to the blight, make a madness check. The DC is equal to 8 + your tier of madness + your fatigue, and you add your spellcasting modifier to the roll. Tiers of madness are detailed at the end of the subclass description.
Channeling requires one Madness check for every additional hour it is active. When you stop channeling the blight, your fatigue increases by 1.
You are considered a full caster for the purposes of spell level advancement and proficiencies.

sheet.description: Once you connect to the blight, make a madness check. The DC is equal to 8 + your tier of madness + your fatigue, and you add your spellcasting modifier to the roll. Channeling requires one Madness check for every additional hour it is active. When you stop channeling the blight, your fatigue increases by 1.

description.p: At 3rd level, when you finish a long rest you can choose another Form and Technique. You gain proficiency in those as if you learned them from your minor feature until you finish your next long rest.

sheet.description: When you finish a long rest you can choose another Form and Technique. You gain proficiency in those as if you learned them from your minor feature until you finish your next long rest.

description.p: At 6th level, you begin to pick up talents seemingly foreign to you. You gain the proficiencies of a half caster, and learn one Stance which you can enter into as a bonus action.

At 10th level, the depths of your mind are impossibly deep and treacherous. You gain resistance to psychic damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If you would gain resistance to psychic damage through another feature, instead you gain immunity, and you cannot be affected by spells lower than half your spell level rounded up.
Additionally, any attempts at invading your mind are met with shrieks of anguish and crazed laughter, inflicting Indefinite Madness on the invader.

sheet.description: The depths of your mind are impossibly deep and treacherous. You gain resistance to psychic damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If you would gain resistance to psychic damage through another feature, instead you gain immunity, and you cannot be affected by spells lower than {{spell half:usage}} Additionally, any attempts at invading your mind are met with shrieks of anguish and crazed laughter, inflicting Indefinite Madness on the invader.

description.p: At 14th level, your connection to the blight enables you to see through the fabric of reality. You gain 60ft of Truesight.

Additionally, you can use an action to step into or out of the Ethereal Plane, as if casting Etherealness. This feature can also be used to enter your Rift from anywhere else besides a gate, although you cannot take others with you as you normally would.

Additionally, you can use an action to step into or out of the Ethereal Plane, as if casting Etherealness. This feature can also be used to enter your Rift from anywhere else besides a gate, although you cannot take others with you as you normally would.

description.p: Starting at level 20, if you are sane, you learn to accept the voices in your head. You gain proficiency in all techniques and forms, and no longer adhere to the rules regarding madness.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in all techniques and forms, and no longer adhere to the rules regarding madness.

description.p: When you create a Maniac Hermeticist, you gain a resource called Sanity that decreases as your connection with the blight strengthens, eating away at your mind. Your starting Sanity is equal to 80 + 1d20. Your madness decreases by 1d6 everytime you gain a level in this class. If you fail a madness check, your fatigue increases by 1. If you fall unconscious while you have fatigue, your Sanity decreases by 1d6.

You are in control of your own thoughts. You may begin to hear whispers the closer you get to 80. The voice behind these whispers has a personality that is up to your DM, but has long since fallen to Madness.
You become unsettled. Make a Madness check whenever your hit points falls below half your hit point maximum.
You have begun to laugh. Lots. Make a Madness check whenever you make a Wisdom saving throw.
At your DMs discretion, you sometimes speak with the voice of another. Seizing the blight both thrills and terrifies you. Make a Madness check whenever you stop channeling the blight.

Your mind is all but lost to you. Any stressful situation might drive you to extreme behavior. In addition to being fatigued, whenever you fail a Madness check, roll a d100. On a roll of 10 or below, your body becomes temporarily possessed by the voice in your head. The DM determines how this voice acts. You can make a Madness check contested by the Madness check of your voice to regain possession of your body. You do not suffer the negative effects of failing a madness check, although you do not gain back control. A greater restoration spell can also be used to regain control of your body.

You are so far gone with Madness, it becomes a permanent condition. You automatically fail all Madness Checks, and you are irredeemably insane. If you lose your body due to failing the percentile roll, you can only gain it back by the effects of a Greater Restoration spell.

Brings objects and substances into existence from nothing, or makes an already-existing target a "more perfect" version of itself (e.g. healing magic, as healed bodies are nearer perfection than wounded bodies).

description.p: Detects or reveals, enhances a target's natural senses or conveys supernatural ones.

sheet.description: Detects or reveals, enhances a target's natural senses or conveys supernatural ones.

description.p: Alters the nature of a being, object or substance, adding unnatural traits and/or removing natural ones. Also includes manipulation of the target in any way that does not alter its nature, e.g. direct a target's movement, put a creature to sleep, or force a tree to bear fruit out of season. This is the main Technique used in spells of protection or 'warding'.
